Generate Interaction Sentences with Logging and Error Handling

generate_interaction_sentences.Rd

This function generates sentences based on the interaction of two variables in a fitted model. It logs all steps, including inputs, outputs, data transformations, and p-value extraction.

Usage

generate_interaction_sentences(
  interaction_model,
  variable1,
  variable2,
  model_summary = NULL,
  confidence_level = 0.95,
  log_transform = TRUE,
  output_format = "text"
)

Arguments

interaction_model

A fitted model object (e.g., from glm or lmer).

variable1

A string representing the first interacting variable.

variable2

A string representing the second interacting variable.

model_summary

A summary object of the model. If NULL, it will be generated automatically.

confidence_level

The confidence level for the confidence intervals. Default is 0.95.

log_transform

A logical indicating if the rate should be log-transformed. Default is TRUE.

output_format

A string specifying the output format: "text" or "markdown". Default is "text".

Value

A list of sentences describing the interaction between the two variables.

Examples

# Example 1: Basic usage with text output
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
result <- generate_interaction_sentences(interaction_model, "scenario", "insurance", output_format = "text")
} # }

# Example 2: Markdown format output
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
result <- generate_interaction_sentences(interaction_model, "scenario", "insurance", output_format = "markdown")
} # }

# Example 3: Custom confidence level
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
result <- generate_interaction_sentences(interaction_model, "scenario", "insurance", confidence_level = 0.90)
} # }
